body_html:
Please note that while it's correct that BoringSSL declined to carry this patch, that's because we don't support big-endian systems and will produce the wrong results on big-endian systems. The unittests will catch this all over the place and that's why it's not possible to compile BoringSSL on big-endian systems.

In keeping with most Google software, we have no plans to support big-endian systems and recommend that this patch be reverted. It'll just mislead people.
body_text:
Please note that while it's correct that BoringSSL declined to carry this patch, that's because we don't support big-endian systems and will produce the wrong results on big-endian systems. The unittests will catch this all over the place and that's why it's not possible to compile BoringSSL on big-endian systems.
In keeping with most Google software, we have no plans to support big-endian systems and recommend that this patch be reverted. It'll just mislead people.
body:
Please note that while it's correct that BoringSSL declined to carry this patch, that's because we don't support big-endian systems and _will produce the wrong results on big-endian systems_. The unittests will catch this all over the place and that's why it's not possible to compile BoringSSL on big-endian systems.

In keeping with most Google software, we have no plans to support big-endian systems and recommend that this patch be reverted. It'll just mislead people.
